message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.
• From the income statement, Gross Profit = 1,136,701.10 and Total Revenue = 6,836,701.10.
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100
  = (1,136,701.10 / 6,836,701.10) × 100 ≈ 16.63%

Step 2: Calculate the Cash Flow to Debt Ratio.
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –6,856,840.58.
• From the balance sheet, the current liabilities (used as debt) = Accounts Payable + Taxes Payable = 1,260,000.00 + 341,835.08 = 1,601,835.08.
• Cash Flow to Debt Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Total Debt
  = –6,856,840.58 / 1,601,835.08 ≈ –4.28

Thus, the answer is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Gross Profit Margin": "16.63%",
    "Cash Flow to Debt Ratio": "-4.28"
  }
}
